column4: i've managed to break the ethernet network in the same *weird* way in two ubuntu installs, and can't seem to find out what it is: dhcp works, udp hence too, icmp works, BUT i can't establish tcp connections! it seems the card doesn't send anything...uber puzzled. please help!
can you surf the web?
nope, not anything involving tcp
can you have a dump of one of your trials?
sure, what would you like to see?
just a sec
try issuing a "sudo tcpdump -i eth0 -s0 -w test.pcap tcp port 80" and try to make a test connection to www.google.com
right on
paste the results on a pastebin so that I can see whats going on
you van read that file with "sudo tcpdump -r test.pcap"
http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/547705
only can try connections to the router (192.168.1.1), as internet isn't reachable over ethernet here (i have only 3G here)
most probably your router at 192.168.1.1 is blocking the connections
i can connect to the router when in other OS or even with a liveCD
what makes you believe this is not related to a hardware problem
the fact that i've been able to use the nic under a liveCD / other OS
is it possible that there have been a driver update in the OS?

perhaps, what puzzles me is that the same problem arised on my laptop before (months ago). I was on a different network then, and could only do dhcp and icmp. Thought then it was a damaged nic, but after seeing the same here and knowing it's specific to this installation i'm puzzled
sorry, me too..
I'm also puzzled
thanks much anyway for helping fellow
you're welcome
